com.sdk.inplayer.api

Class Account

  • com.sdk.inplayer.api.Account

  • public class Account

    An account represents a user. By using this resource, you can create consumer accounts, update data for a specific customer, (de)activate your account and so on.

    • Method Summary

      • signUp

        public void signUp(@NotNull
                   java.lang.String fullName,
                   @NotNull
                   java.lang.String email,
                   @NotNull
                   java.lang.String password,
                   @NotNull
                   java.lang.String passwordConfirmation,
                   @NotNull
                   InPlayerCallback<com.sdk.inplayer.model.account.InPlayerAuthorizationModel,com.sdk.inplayer.model.error.InPlayerException> callback)

        Registers a new InPlayer account.

        Parameters:
        fullName - String Account's first and last name
        email - String Account’s email address
        password - String Password containing minimum 8 characters
        passwordConfirmation - String The same password with minimum 8 characters
        callback - InPlayerCallback

        Parameters:
        fullName - String Account's first and last name
        email - String Account’s email address
        password - String Password containing minimum 8 characters
        passwordConfirmation - String The same password with minimum 8 characters
        metadata - HashMap Additional information about the account that can be attached to the account object
        callback - InPlayerCallback<{@code InPlayerAuthorizationModel}, {@code InPlayerException}>

                       @NotNull

        Refreshes account using refreshToken

        Parameters:
        refreshToken - String An auto-generated token that enables access when the original access token has expired withoutrequiring re authentication
